intro: Exacum subverticillatum, commonly known as the spiral flower or spiral vine, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is characterized by its unique spiral arrangement of leaves and its clusters of small, tubular flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. The plant is a member of the Primulaceae family and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. It thrives in warm, humid environments and requires well-drained soil to prevent root rot. Its compact growth habit makes it suitable for hanging baskets or as a trailing plant in gardens.
